back_cards.example_en: She lives alone in a small apartment.
He felt alone despite being in a crowd.
Her talent stands alone in the industry.
I completed the project alone.
This decision is mine alone.
She drinks coffee every morning.
They drank wine at the party.

back_cards.definition_en: To absorb or take in something.
back_cards.example_en: The plants drink water from the soil.

back_cards.definition_en: To toast or celebrate with a beverage.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s drink to good health!
He doesn’t drink soda anymore.

back_cards.definition_en: A formal inquiry to uncover facts.
back_cards.example_en: The police launched an investigation into the crime.
Her investigation revealed new data.

back_cards.definition_en: A review in a workplace context.
back_cards.example_en: The company conducted an investigation into the complaint.
The investigation led to an arrest.
His investigation into the war was thorough.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of a legislative senate.
back_cards.example_en: The senator proposed a new bill.
She met the senator at a town hall.
The senator spoke on national security.
The Roman senator influenced policy.
Our senator focuses on education reform.
The apartment unit is fully furnished.
The military unit trained for months.
The recipe calls for one unit of sugar.
The air conditioning unit broke down.
We finished the unit on biology.

back_cards.definition_en: A picture taken with a camera.
back_cards.example_en: She framed the photograph of her family.
The photograph captured the sunset perfectly.
The photograph showed the accident scene.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of art in exhibitions.
back_cards.example_en: His photograph won a gallery award.
I keep a photograph of my dog in my wallet.

back_cards.definition_en: The seventh month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: We’re planning a trip in July.
July is perfect for beach vacations.
Fireworks light up the sky every July.
The treaty was signed in July 1945.
July brings heat to our region.
We watched the game on television.
She works in television as a producer.
Television keeps the kids busy.

back_cards.definition_en: A tool for news and information.
back_cards.example_en: The debate was aired on national television.
Reality television has changed viewing habits.
I lost the key to my car.
Hard work is the key to success.
Press the enter key to submit.
The song is in the key of C.

back_cards.definition_en: A guide in maps or texts.
back_cards.example_en: Check the map’s key for symbols.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to physical attraction or intimacy.
back_cards.example_en: The movie had a sexual theme.
Sexual reproduction occurs in many species.
Their sexual chemistry was undeniable.
The survey asked about sexual identity.
The book contained sexual scenes.
I listen to the radio every morning.
She hosts a show on local radio.
The radio alerted us to the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: A source of music and news.
back_cards.example_en: The radio played my favorite song.
Radio was vital during the war.
Wearing a helmet can prevent injuries.
The lock prevented unauthorized entry.
Good hygiene prevents illness.
Rain prevented us from hiking.
The police prevented a conflict.

back_cards.definition_en: A single time in the past.
back_cards.example_en: I met her once at a conference.

back_cards.definition_en: As soon as, when used with time.
back_cards.example_en: Call me once you arrive.
Once, this town was thriving.
He was once a famous actor.
I go hiking once a year.
Modern technology changes daily.
The house has a modern kitchen.
She wears modern fashion styles.
Modern medicine saves lives.
Modern art challenges traditional forms.
The senate passed a new law.
The Roman senate advised the consuls.
The issue was discussed in the senate.
The senate includes two members per state.
The senate building is heavily guarded.
The protest turned to violence.
Domestic violence is a serious issue.
The storm’s violence damaged homes.
The movie contained graphic violence.
The city addressed rising violence.
Don’t touch the wet paint.
Her story touched everyone’s hearts.
He hasn’t touched his homework yet.

back_cards.definition_en: To reach or approach a level.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature touched 90 degrees.
The speech touched on climate change.
The car’s best feature is its mileage.

back_cards.definition_en: A highlight in media or products.
back_cards.example_en: The phone’s camera is a key feature.
The mountain is a feature of the region.
The magazine ran a feature on local artists.
The building’s feature is its glass facade.
The audience clapped after the play.
The show has a global audience.
The politician addressed the audience.
The ad targets a young audience.
The presenter engaged the audience well.

back_cards.definition_en: The time between afternoon and night.
back_cards.example_en: We went for a walk this evening.
The gala is held every evening.
I relax in the evening with a book.
Evening classes start at 6 p.m.
The evening was filled with laughter.
